CatDescriptText: Article accompanying related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, July 29, 1950, pg. 10, reads: "Reception at Kay Boys Club For Newlyweds - A reception at the Kay Boys Club followed the marriage ceremony of Miss Ruth Lillian Willis, daughter of Mr. and Mrs. Silas Morrison Willis, and Walter Boyd Lowry, son of Marshall Lowry of Pittsburgh. The wedding took place Saturday, July 22 at Grace Memorial Presbyterian Church with the Rev. Harold L. Tolliver officiating.  Wearing a gown of white nylon marquisette, the bride was given in marriage by her father.  Bridal attendants were Mrs. Russell Strothers as matron of honor, and Miss Jean Willis and Miss Barbara Alston as bridesmaids.  William R. Lowry served as the groom's best man.  Ushers were Vance L. Sales, Charles R. Lowry, and William B. Taliaferro.  Following a wedding trip, the couple will reside at 124 Henderson Street in Pittsburgh."
TitMainTitle: Groom Walter Boyd Lowry wearing light colored dinner jacket, and bride Ruth Lillian Willis Lowry wearing long sleeved nylon gown with row of buttons on front, and mid length veil, posed holding bouquet, in interior beside palm tree, possibly at Kay Boys Club
